title: Visiting early at prime times
authors: Tony Haddad, Sun-Kai Leung, Cihan Sabuncu
abstract:
Given an integer $m \geq 2$ and a sufficiently large $q$, we apply a variant
of the Maynard--Tao sieve weight to establish the existence of an arithmetic
progression with common difference $q$ for which the $m$-th least prime in such
progression is $\ll_m q$, which is best possible. As we vary over progressions
instead of fixing a particular one, the nature of our result differs from
others in the literature. Furthermore, we generalize our result to dynamical
systems. The quality of the result depends crucially on the first return time,
which we illustrate in the case of Diophantine approximation.
